snippet: The prosecutors rejected a claim by a fund-raiser for John C. Liu, the New York City comptroller, that he had been pressured to implicate Mr. Liu in criminal practices.
abstract: Federal prosecutors file court papers sharply rejecting claims that authorities had sought to pressure Xing Wu Pan, former fund-raiser for New York City Comptroller John C Liu, into helping implicate him in criminal practices; United States attorney's office also offers broad defense of tactics used in an investigation that has led to the indictments of both Pan and Jia Hou, Liu's former campaign treasurer.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and DAVID W. CHEN

lead_paragraph: The prosecutors rejected a claim by a fund-raiser for John C. Liu, the New York City comptroller, that he had been pressured to implicate Mr. Liu in criminal practices.

headline.seo: U.S. Lawyers Deny Effort to Make Up Case Against Liu
headline.main: U.S. Prosecutors Deny Effort to Make Up Case Against Liu
headline.print_headline: U.S. Prosecutors Deny Effort to Make Up Case Against Liu
